tool.name: Fast5 subset
tool.command:
## initialize mkdir data && #for $num, $current in enumerate($i) ln -s '$current' 'data/batch${num}.fast5' && #end for
## run fast5_subset ## required -i data -s results -l $l ## optional -n $n -t \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4}

param.name: l
param.label: Select file with read_ids
param.help: Either containing 1 read_id per line or a tabular file with a column named read_id. (-l,--read_id_list)

param.name: n
param.label: Set batch size
param.help: Number of single reads to include in each multi read file (-n, --batch_size)

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
@WID@
fast5_subset extracts reads from multi_read_fast5_file(s) based on a list of read IDs.
**Input**
A multi read file in FAST5 format and a list of read IDs that should be extracted.
**Output**
A multi read file in FAST5 format containing a subset of the input file.
.. class:: infomark
**References**
@REFERENCES@
